text: [Music]
hey guys angel here today I am super
excited because we are making Taiwanese
pork burgers also known as Gua Bao now
we're actually using the braising liquid
from my last video so I saved the
braising liquid from my slow cooker pork
belly recipe and I am reusing it today
in the slow cooker so I have my slow
cooker behind me and I have two new
pieces of pork belly in there they've
been braising for a few hours now and
they're almost ready so I want to get
together all the other ingredients so we
can make these pork burgers so let's get
started to start I'm using two thick
slabs of pork belly and since I'm going
to put this in the steam bun I'm cutting
the pork into slices that will fit the
width of the bun next brown the pork
belly slices for a few minutes before
placing them into your slow cooker and
like I mentioned before I'm using the
braising liquid that I saved for my last
video on making slow cooker braised pork
belly and if you need that recipe I'll
leave a link in the video description
after getting my slow-cooker going I've
got it set on high for six hours a bit
later in the day when the pork is almost
done I'm going to prepare some pickled
mustard greens which come in a bag like
this and I'm going to cut them into
small pieces like so next rinse and soak
the pieces in cold water for ten minutes
to remove some of the saltiness because
these are super or salty after ten
minutes drain and stir-fry the mustard
greens on medium heat with a tablespoon
of oil and to season this I'm going to
add some organic cane sugar - feel free
to add to your taste preference but
today I'm using about 1 tablespoon of
cane sugar continue to stir-fry for a
few minutes until the sugar has
completely mixed in and the mustard
greens are slightly soft then set aside
to cool now it's time to steam the bends
bring a pot of water to a boil and
prepare a steamer of frozen steamed buns
here I'm cutting up some parchment paper
first the place underneath the buns so
they don't stick and today I'm only
going to steam two buns because I
probably shouldn't eat more than two and
if you're wondering yes you can
microwave these as well but I feel like
steaming produces a softer bun but if
you're steaming the bun should be ready
in 8 to 10 minutes and off to the side
while the buns are steaming I'm going to
take some honey roasted peanuts and
crush them up to make powdered honey
roasted peanuts and now back to our
steamer and here guys is a close-up of
the steamed bun as you can see they are
super warm and steamy
now that we have everything ready to go
and the meat in the slow cooker is
tender it's time to assemble our bow
start by placing a large generous piece
of pork belly in the steam Ben okay look
at that I think I got a little greedy
don't do that we need it a little bit
thinner maybe like half of that all
right so let's rewind and slice that
thick piece in half so it fits better
into our bow and just so you guys can
see how tender this meat is here's a
close-up now back to assembling put your
pork in first then top with a generous
amount of pickled mustard greens some
crushed peanuts and some of that
braising liquid on top okay probably
should have put that braising liquid
under the peanuts first but hey better
late than never and finally top with a
ton of fresh cilantro for garnish
[Music]
so that's how you make Taiwanese pork
burger or co-op out they are super
delicious and I want to try this for you
but I'm not gonna eat this on camera I
know they're super messy and every time
you eat one I just I need so many
napkins so sorry I'm gonna skip the
taste test but you guys can tell how
good it is on camera because just look
at all that juicy goodness there thank
you guys so much for watching I just
have one question for you before I end
today's video and that is how many pork
burgers can you guys eat for me I tried
eating too cuz I got greedy once and I
was at like 1 and a quarter and it was
just total failure I could not eat
anymore it was just way too much but I
want to know how many you guys could eat
post in the comments below and let me
know and I will see you guys in the next
video bye for now
[Music]
